faq.question: Can crawl my website?
faq.answer: No. can add clustering of search results to an existing search engine. You can use an Open Source project called Nutch to crawl your website. Nutch has a -based search clustering plugin, so you'll get all crawling, searching and clustering in one piece. If you need help with any of these, please contact us.

faq.question: Can I use to cluster something else than search results?
faq.answer: Absolutely. came about as a framework for building search results clustering engines but its algorithms should successfully cluster up to about a thousand text documents, a few paragraphs each.

faq.question: Can I force to cluster my documents to some predefined clusters / labels?
faq.answer: No. Assigning documents to a set of predefined categories is a problem called text classification / categorization and was not designed to solve it. For text classification components you may want to see the LingPipe project.

faq.question: How does clustering scale with respect to the number and length of documents?
faq.answer: The most important characteristic of algorithms to keep in mind is that they perform in-memory clustering. For this reason, as a rule of thumb, should successfully deal with up to a thousand of documents, a few paragraphs each. For algorithms designed to process millions of documents, you may want to check out the Mahout project.

faq.question: Can I perform clustering without specifying the query?
faq.answer: Yes. While the query is usually very helpful to get rid of the obvious meanings related to the documents in the search results set, it is not obligatory -- the clustering algorithms will cope without the query.

faq.question: Can I use in a commercial project?
faq.answer: Yes. The only requirement is that you properly acknowledge the use of (on the project's website and documentation) and let us know about your project. Please also remember to read the license.

faq.question: How can I acknowledge the use of on my site?
faq.answer: Please put a statement equivalent to "This product includes software developed by the Carrot2 Project" on your site and link it to 's website (http://www.carrot2.org). Additionally, you can use some of our powered-by logos if you like.
